headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE.; COTTON STEADY--BREADSTUFFS EASIER. Failure of Dodge, Bacon & Co, for f100,000. THE NEWS BY THE ARAGO. Consols Steady at 93 3-8. Lord Elgin Appointed British Plenipotentiary to Pekin. IMPORTANT FROM CHINA Interesting Proceedings in the British Parliament. Arrival of the Arage at this port and the Europa at Halifax. RELATIONS WITH THE UNITED STATES. English View of the Selection of Gen. Cass Secretary of State. TheThreatened War Between Spain and Mexico. THE TREATY WITH PERSIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamship Arago, Capt. LIBRA, from Havre and Southampton, has arrived, with advices from England to the 11th March. She has had a very rough passage, and a constant succession of heavy westerly galos. March 24th, 2 P. M., ??at. 43, lon. 56?? 15;. passed a brigantine standing north, showing a red flag with a white ball in the centre.

headline.main: Withdrawal of Mr. Appleton from the Union--The New-York Appointments--The Governership of Kansus--Health of the President, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite all the quanted contractions which have been sent abroad, Mr. APPLETON will retire from the Union, and without any unnecessary delay. In health will be assigned as the moving cause, but there are other reasons equally influential, concerning which it has not been deemed expedient to enlighten the public.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. Magnetic Telegraph Co.'s Offices--4 Honover-st., and 181 Broadway INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON. Robert J. Walker's Appointment-His Proclivities judged by his Antecedents--Sangnine View of the Prospects of his Administration in Kansas.

docs.lead_paragraph: Until Mr. ROBERT J. WALKER can prevail upon his family, and some of his intimate friends, to drop their strong opposition to his making Kansas his home for so long a period as would be requisite in order to accomplish the task, in that Territory, which the Administration requires at his hands. I fear it will be difficult for him to go.

docs.lead_paragraph: PIEECE by citizens of Philadelphia, headed by Mayor VAUX, but has been declined in the following note" WASHINGTON, Saturday, March 21, 1857. Gentlemen : In consequence of the state of Mrs. PIKEOK'S health, I have been unable to speak definitely in relation to my movements. and hence have delayed to answer your very gratifying letter of the 27th ultimo.

docs.lead_paragraph: We little anticipated, when we predicted yesterday the probable fate of Mr. EBLING, that our words would so soon prove prophetic. Since then, however, within the short space of twenty-four hours, the " society of scavengers" has done its work; Mr. EBLING'S monument has been erected by that fragrant corporation, and, what is more, we have seen it.

docs.lead_paragraph: A great number of remonstrances were presented in both houses of the Legilature yesterday, against any modification or repeal of the law of 1814 relative to Trinity Church. The Senate posied the bill in relation to marriages, lively introduced by Mr. YASNUM, In the Assembly, the Judiciary Committee reported a resolution, consideration of which was postponed for one week,
